title: Vulcan to launch Peregrine lunar lander on inaugural flight
summary: United Launch Alliance(ULA) is preparing to return the US to the Moon with the launch of Astrobotic’s Peregrine lunar lander atop its brand-new Vulcan Centaur rocket.

title: UAE Will Build Airlock for Artemis Gateway Lunar Space Station
summary: NASA announced this morning that the United Arab Emirates is joining the Artemis campaign to return astronauts to the Moon. The UAE will provide an airlock for the Gateway space […]

title: United Arab Emirates to Build Gateway Airlock
summary: NASA and the Mohammed bin Rashid Space Centre (MBRSC) of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) announced Sunday plans for the space centre to provide an airlock for Gateway, humanity’s first space station outside of Low Earth Orbit. The lunar space station, positioned in a Near Rectilinear Halo Orbit, will support NASA’s missions for long-term exploration of the Moon under Artemis as part of NASA’s Moon to Mars initiative.

title: UAE to build airlock for lunar Gateway
summary: The United Arab Emirates has agreed to develop an airlock module for the lunar Gateway, helping complete the design of the lunar space station while enhancing the UAE’s role in the Artemis lunar exploration effort.

title: NASA and SDA optical campaigns could share terminals
summary: NASA will determine whether the commercial terminals the Space Development Agency is adopting for satellite-to-satellite communications can also transmit data to Earth.

title: NASA adds funding to Blue Origin and Voyager Space commercial space station agreements
summary: NASA has added milestones and funding to agreements with two companies working on commercial space station concepts using money from a third agreement that ended last year.

title: Vulcan Rolls to Pad Ahead of Debut Flight
summary: On Friday, January 5, United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan rocket rolled to the pad for the first time, ahead of its first flight scheduled for January 8, 2024. This pad roll represents the culmination of nearly a decade and a half of development work across the American aerospace industry, ringing in a new era for modern rocketry.

title: India’s Aditya-L1 solar observatory enters orbit around Lagrange point
summary: India’s Aditya-L1 solar observatory has reached its destination orbit around Sun-Earth Lagrange point 1 around 1.5 million kilometers from Earth.

title: Vulcan on the pad for its first launch
summary: After a decade of development, United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan Centaur rocket is finally on the launch pad for its inaugural launch, carrying not just a lunar lander but also the company’s future.

title: Space Force on the verge of finalizing long-awaited commercial space strategy
summary: The commercial space strategy will guide the Space Force's integration of commercial satellite services into its routine operations.
